page.title: 01LOWDHAM.
page.content: Lowdham is a village situated eight miles north-east of Nottingham.It is sited at the crossing of two main roads;the A6097 linking Doncaster and Leicester and the A612 linking Nottingham with Newark. The village lies on the edge of the Trent Valley ,approximately two miles from the river. Lowdham was one of the first commuter villages around Nottingham. In 1846 a station was built at Lowdham by the Midland Railway Company. Gradually Victorian properties were built here by those working in Nottingham. The number of people living in Lowdham now exceeds two thousand, although few people work locally.
